meanings.sent1: The pressurised container kept the food fresh.
meanings.sent2: The pressurised room felt tight and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The pressurised balloon made funny noises as it deflated.
meanings.sent4: Her pressurised schedule made her feel like she was going to burst.
meanings.sent5: The pressurised water hose sprayed with great force.

meanings.sent1: He pressurised the wound to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson tried to pressurise the customer into buying more.
meanings.sent3: The chef pressurised the dough to make it rise faster.
meanings.sent4: The coach pressurised the team to perform their best in the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pressurised the students to finish their assignments on time.

meanings.definition: Filled with or containing pressurized air or gas.
meanings.sent1: The pressurised cabin provided oxygen for the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The pressurised tire held up well on the bumpy road.
meanings.sent3: The pressurised canister hissed as the gas escaped.
meanings.sent4: The pressurised balloon floated high in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The pressurised scuba tank allowed for longer dives.
